page.title: 07Shopping, Thurleigh
page.content: There is only one shop in Thurleigh and this is also the village post office. It is well stocked and there is very little that cannot be purchased there. The owner also delivers newspapers to the village and will deliver groceries to anyone in the area for no extra charge. The village also has several fruit and vegetable stalls, these are run from private homes. The garage and filling station also sells sweets, biscuits and cakes. There are two mobile fish vans that call weekly, one of which also sells greengrocery. There is also a large frozen foods company based in the area and they deliver anything imaginable - ice cream, gateaux, meat, fish to name but a few. The milkman calls on alternate days. There is just one public house now, there used to be 3, a butchers and 2 general stores.
